==Japanese==

{{ja-kanjitab|かん|ご|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=かんご}} {{m|zh|sc=Hani|漢語}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|かんご|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かんご}}

# A [[kango]]: a Japanese word of Chinese origin, or a Japanese word coined along Chinese lines (a Sino-Japanese word) (such as {{l|ja|社会}} or {{l|ja|共和国}}).
#: ''Kango'' are written in [[kanji]], and read with the ''on'yomi'' ({{l|ja|音読み}}). Contrast with ''wago'' ({{l|ja|和語}}).
# The ancient Chinese [[language]], the language of the [[Han]] ({{m|zh|sc=Hani|漢}}) [[ethnicity]].
# {{qualifier|less commonly}} The Chinese language.
